intro: Coelospermum biovulatum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a dense rosette of foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Coelospermum biovulatum thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
